intro: Chazaliella pilosula, commonly known as the silky chazalina, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native range.
